content: As another user noted in the forum, this is not lexicographical sorting either. That would be alphabetical, and this is numerical. So several terms used in the puzzle are imprecise.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Verges on CoC in simplicity but would be good for beginners regarding indexing and sorting.

(Deleted previous comment - I misread the description but after re-reading, I realised my mistake)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a nice and easy introductory puzzle for newcomers. Very comprehensive. I like it quite a lot.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it's a good puzzle

It might help to have additional test cases in lower dimensions (up to 4 or 5) to help debug any issues. In particular, right now the 3D test and 3D validator are going to catch different types of bugs. Also, "partial order" has a specific meaning in math which this is not. So I would say, "Given an n-dimensional topological space and a definition of order, ..."
Please change "Indexation of vectors begins at 1." to "Indexation of vectors begins at 1 (input line 4)."

Goal
* Please change "a n-dimensional" to "an n-dimensional".

* Please change "an partial" to "a partial".

* Please change "[[2,3,1]]" to "{{2 3 1}}" (notice that the brackets have changed so that the text is formatted as a constant).

* Please change "the coordinate of each vector" to "the coordinates of each vector".

* The meaning of "lexicographical" can be ambiguous as it can mean ordering elements like strings (so "100" comes before "20") and it can also refer to numeric lexicographical order (so 20 comes before 100). Is it ok if the word is omitted in all sections (Goal, Input, Output)?

* Suggest to change "the first lexicographical lookup must be" to "the coordinates should be sorted first by".

Cases
* Test 4 (Biggest number of dimensions): d = 128, so the first constraint is violated.

Thanks.

Thanks for your feedback!

I tried to make the ordering relation I want to be clearer, tell me if it's enough.

For the last point, it was just a typo in the constraints statement
I wonder if swapping input lines 2 and 3 would make interpretation of the example easier.

My mistake, I did raise this issue in my deleted comment but I assumed I was wrong since 2 others already accepted.

I think you're high enough level to edit, so potentially edit it until the author views and changes it themselves, if required.
I've changed "lexicographical" to "ascending" in Goal section.

Constraints
* Please change "never doubles" to "no duplicates".

Thanks.

Goal
* Please change "given you as input" to "given as input".

* Suggest to change the last line of the statement to "For instance, in a 3D space, with {{2 3 1}} as coordinates permutation, the vectors should be sorted first by their 2nd coordinate, then their 3rd, then their 1st."

Thanks.

Thank you @Senua for following up.

I agree with both points in the last comment from @yhuberla. I also suggested {{2 3 1}} instead of {{2,3,1}} in my earlier comment because no commas are used in the cases.
